main_definition: A one-cent coin in British currency or a term used to represent something of little value.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A one-cent coin in the UK monetary system, equal to 1/100th of a pound sterling.
meanings_and_examples.example: I found an old penny on the ground while walking through London.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression used to refer to something very cheap or insignificant in value.
meanings_and_examples.example: Buying lunch from that fast-food place will cost you a few pennies. It's quite affordable!

meanings_and_examples.definition: In American English, it refers to the one cent coin which was once used as part of their currency system before being phased out.
meanings_and_examples.example: We can see old penny coins at some antique shops.
